00027 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"
00028 
00029 #include "BLI_math.h"
00030 #include "BLI_array.h"
00031 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00032 
00033 #include "bmesh.h"
00034 
00035 #include "intern/bmesh_operators_private.h" /* own include */
00036 
00037 #define VERT_INPUT  1
00038 #define EDGE_OUT    1
00039 #define FACE_NEW    2
00040 #define EDGE_MARK   4
00041 #define EDGE_DONE   8
00042 
00043 void bmo_connectverts_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00044 {
00045     BMIter iter, liter;
00046     BMFace *f, *nf;
00047     BMLoop **loops = NULL, *lastl = NULL;
00048     BLI_array_declare(loops);
00049     BMLoop *l, *nl;
00050     BMVert **verts = NULL;
00051     BLI_array_declare(verts);
00052     int i;
00053     
00054     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "verts", BM_VERT, VERT_INPUT);
00055 
00056     for (f = BM_iter_new(&iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH, NULL); f; f = BM_iter_step(&iter)) {
00057         BLI_array_empty(loops);
00058         BLI_array_empty(verts);
00059         
00060         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, FACE_NEW)) {
00061             continue;
00062         }
00063 
00064         l = BM_iter_new(&liter, bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, f);
00065         lastl = NULL;
00066         for ( ; l; l = BM_iter_step(&liter)) {
00067             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, VERT_INPUT)) {
00068                 if (!lastl) {
00069                     lastl = l;
00070                     continue;
00071                 }
00072 
00073                 if (lastl != l->prev && lastl != l->next) {
00074                     BLI_array_growone(loops);
00075                     loops[BLI_array_count(loops) - 1] = lastl;
00076 
00077                     BLI_array_growone(loops);
00078                     loops[BLI_array_count(loops) - 1] = l;
00079 
00080                 }
00081                 lastl = l;
00082             }
00083         }
00084 
00085         if (BLI_array_count(loops) == 0) {
00086             continue;
00087         }
00088         
00089         if (BLI_array_count(loops) > 2) {
00090             BLI_array_growone(loops);
00091             loops[BLI_array_count(loops) - 1] = loops[BLI_array_count(loops) - 2];
00092 
00093             BLI_array_growone(loops);
00094             loops[BLI_array_count(loops) - 1] = loops[0];
00095         }
00096 
00097         BM_face_legal_splits(bm, f, (BMLoop *(*)[2])loops, BLI_array_count(loops) / 2);
00098         
00099         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(loops) / 2; i++) {
00100             if (loops[i * 2] == NULL) {
00101                 continue;
00102             }
00103 
00104             BLI_array_growone(verts);
00105             verts[BLI_array_count(verts) - 1] = loops[i * 2]->v;
00106 
00107             BLI_array_growone(verts);
00108             verts[BLI_array_count(verts) - 1] = loops[i * 2 + 1]->v;
00109         }
00110 
00111         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(verts) / 2; i++) {
00112             nf = BM_face_split(bm, f, verts[i * 2], verts[i * 2 + 1], &nl, NULL, FALSE);
00113             f = nf;
00114             
00115             if (!nl || !nf) {
00116                 BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_CONNECTVERT_FAILED, NULL);
00117                 BLI_array_free(loops);
00118                 return;
00119             }
00120             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, nf, FACE_NEW);
00121             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, nl->e, EDGE_OUT);
00122         }
00123     }
00124 
00125     BMO_slot_buffer_from_enabled_flag(bm, op, "edgeout", BM_EDGE, EDGE_OUT);
00126 
00127     BLI_array_free(loops);
00128     BLI_array_free(verts);
00129 }
00130 
00131 static BMVert *get_outer_vert(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *e)
00132 {
00133     BMIter iter;
00134     BMEdge *e2;
00135     int i;
00136 
00137     i = 0;
00138     BM_ITER_ELEM (e2, &iter, e->v1, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00139         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e2, EDGE_MARK)) {
00140             i++;
00141         }
00142     }
00143 
00144     return (i == 2) ? e->v2 : e->v1;
00145 }
00146 
00147 /* Clamp x to the interval {0..len-1}, with wrap-around */
00148 static int clamp_index(const int x, const int len)
00149 {
00150     if (x >= 0) {
00151         return x % len;
00152     }
00153     else {
00154         int r = len - (-x % len);
00155         if (r == len)
00156             return len - 1;
00157         else
00158             return r;
00159     }
00160 }
00161 
00162 /* There probably is a better way to swap BLI_arrays, or if there
00163  * isn't there should be... */
00164 #define ARRAY_SWAP(elemtype, arr1, arr2)                                      \
00165     {                                                                         \
00166         int i;                                                                \
00167         elemtype *arr_tmp = NULL;                                             \
00168         BLI_array_declare(arr_tmp);                                           \
00169         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(arr1); i++) {                         \
00170             BLI_array_append(arr_tmp, arr1[i]);                               \
00171         }                                                                     \
00172         BLI_array_empty(arr1);                                                \
00173         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(arr2); i++) {                         \
00174             BLI_array_append(arr1, arr2[i]);                                  \
00175         }                                                                     \
00176         BLI_array_empty(arr2);                                                \
00177         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(arr_tmp); i++) {                      \
00178             BLI_array_append(arr2, arr_tmp[i]);                               \
00179         }                                                                     \
00180         BLI_array_free(arr_tmp);                                              \
00181     }
00182 
00183 /* get the 2 loops matching 2 verts.
00184  * first attempt to get the face corners that use the edge defined by v1 & v2,
00185  * if that fails just get any loop thats on the vert (the first one) */
00186 static void bm_vert_loop_pair(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, BMLoop **l1, BMLoop **l2)
00187 {
00188     BMIter liter;
00189     BMLoop *l;
00190 
00191     if ((v1->e && v1->e->l) &&
00192         (v2->e && v2->e->l))
00193     {
00194         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &liter, v1, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00195             if (l->prev->v == v2) {
00196                 *l1 = l;
00197                 *l2 = l->prev;
00198                 return;
00199             }
00200             else if (l->next->v == v2) {
00201                 *l1 = l;
00202                 *l2 = l->next;
00203                 return;
00204             }
00205         }
00206     }
00207 
00208     /* fallback to _any_ loop */
00209     *l1 = BM_iter_at_index(bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT, v1, 0);
00210     *l2 = BM_iter_at_index(bm, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT, v2, 0);
00211 }
00212 
00213 void bmo_bridge_loops_exec(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op)
00214 {
00215     BMEdge **ee1 = NULL, **ee2 = NULL;
00216     BMVert **vv1 = NULL, **vv2 = NULL;
00217     BLI_array_declare(ee1);
00218     BLI_array_declare(ee2);
00219     BLI_array_declare(vv1);
00220     BLI_array_declare(vv2);
00221     BMOIter siter;
00222     BMIter iter;
00223     BMEdge *e, *nexte;
00224     int c = 0, cl1 = 0, cl2 = 0;
00225 
00226     BMO_slot_buffer_flag_enable(bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE, EDGE_MARK);
00227 
00228     BMO_ITER (e, &siter, bm, op, "edges", BM_EDGE) {
00229         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, EDGE_DONE)) {
00230             BMVert *v, *ov;
00231             /* BMEdge *e2, *e3, *oe = e; */ /* UNUSED */
00232             BMEdge *e2, *e3;
00233             
00234             if (c > 2) {
00235                 BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_INVALID_SELECTION, "Select only two edge loops");
00236                 goto cleanup;
00237             }
00238             
00239             e2 = e;
00240             v = e->v1;
00241             do {
00242                 v = BM_edge_other_vert(e2, v);
00243                 nexte = NULL;
00244                 BM_ITER_ELEM (e3, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00245                     if (e3 != e2 && BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e3, EDGE_MARK)) {
00246                         if (nexte == NULL) {
00247                             nexte = e3;
00248                         }
00249                         else {
00250                             /* edges do not form a loop: there is a disk
00251                              * with more than two marked edges. */
00252                             BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_INVALID_SELECTION,
00253                                             "Selection must only contain edges from two edge loops");
00254                             goto cleanup;
00255                         }
00256                     }
00257                 }
00258                 
00259                 if (nexte)
00260                     e2 = nexte;
00261             } while (nexte && e2 != e);
00262             
00263             if (!e2)
00264                 e2 = e;
00265 
00266             e = e2;
00267             ov = v;
00268             do {
00269                 if (c == 0) {
00270                     BLI_array_append(ee1, e2);
00271                     BLI_array_append(vv1, v);
00272                 }
00273                 else {
00274                     BLI_array_append(ee2, e2);
00275                     BLI_array_append(vv2, v);
00276                 }
00277                 
00278                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e2, EDGE_DONE);
00279                 
00280                 v = BM_edge_other_vert(e2, v);
00281                 BM_ITER_ELEM (e3, &iter, v, BM_EDGES_OF_VERT) {
00282                     if (e3 != e2 && BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e3, EDGE_MARK) && !BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e3, EDGE_DONE)) {
00283                         break;
00284                     }
00285                 }
00286                 if (e3)
00287                     e2 = e3;
00288             } while (e3 && e2 != e);
00289             
00290             if (v && !e3) {
00291                 if (c == 0) {
00292                     if (BLI_array_count(vv1) && v == vv1[BLI_array_count(vv1) - 1]) {
00293                         printf("%s: internal state waning *TODO DESCRIPTION!*\n", __func__);
00294                     }
00295                     BLI_array_append(vv1, v);
00296                 }
00297                 else {
00298                     BLI_array_append(vv2, v);
00299                 }
00300             }
00301             
00302             /* test for connected loops, and set cl1 or cl2 if so */
00303             if (v == ov) {
00304                 if (c == 0) {
00305                     cl1 = 1;
00306                 }
00307                 else {
00308                     cl2 = 1;
00309                 }
00310             }
00311             
00312             c++;
00313         }
00314     }
00315 
00316     if (ee1 && ee2) {
00317         int i, j;
00318         BMVert *v1, *v2, *v3, *v4;
00319         int starti = 0, dir1 = 1, wdir = 0, lenv1, lenv2;
00320 
00321         /* Simplify code below by avoiding the (!cl1 && cl2) case */
00322         if (!cl1 && cl2) {
00323             SWAP(int, cl1, cl2);
00324             ARRAY_SWAP(BMVert *, vv1, vv2);
00325             ARRAY_SWAP(BMEdge *, ee1, ee2);
00326         }
00327 
00328         lenv1 = lenv2 = BLI_array_count(vv1);
00329 
00330         /* Below code assumes vv1/vv2 each have at least two verts. should always be
00331          * a safe assumption, since ee1/ee2 are non-empty and an edge has two verts. */
00332         BLI_assert((lenv1 > 1) && (lenv2 > 1));
00333 
00334         /* BMESH_TODO: Would be nice to handle cases where the edge loops
00335          * have different edge counts by generating triangles & quads for
00336          * the bridge instead of quads only. */
00337         if (BLI_array_count(ee1) != BLI_array_count(ee2)) {
00338             BMO_error_raise(bm, op, BMERR_INVALID_SELECTION,
00339                             "Selected loops must have equal edge counts");
00340             goto cleanup;
00341         }
00342 
00343         j = 0;
00344         if (vv1[0] == vv1[lenv1 - 1]) {
00345             lenv1--;
00346         }
00347         if (vv2[0] == vv2[lenv2 - 1]) {
00348             lenv2--;
00349         }
00350 
00351         /* Find starting point and winding direction for two unclosed loops */
00352         if (!cl1 && !cl2) {
00353             /* First point of loop 1 */
00354             v1 = get_outer_vert(bm, ee1[0]);
00355             /* Last point of loop 1 */
00356             v2 = get_outer_vert(bm, ee1[clamp_index(-1, BLI_array_count(ee1))]);
00357             /* First point of loop 2 */
00358             v3 = get_outer_vert(bm, ee2[0]);
00359             /* Last point of loop 2 */
00360             v4 = get_outer_vert(bm, ee2[clamp_index(-1, BLI_array_count(ee2))]);
00361 
00362             /* If v1 is a better match for v4 than v3, AND v2 is a better match
00363              * for v3 than v4, the loops are in opposite directions, so reverse
00364              * the order of reads from vv1. We can avoid sqrt for comparison */
00365             if (len_squared_v3v3(v1->co, v3->co) > len_squared_v3v3(v1->co, v4->co) &&
00366                 len_squared_v3v3(v2->co, v4->co) > len_squared_v3v3(v2->co, v3->co))
00367             {
00368                 dir1 = -1;
00369                 starti = clamp_index(-1, lenv1);
00370             }
00371         }
00372 
00373         /* Find the shortest distance from a vert in vv1 to vv2[0]. Use that
00374          * vertex in vv1 as a starting point in the first loop, while starting
00375          * from vv2[0] in the second loop. This is a simplistic attempt to get
00376          * a better edge-to-edge match between the two loops. */
00377         if (cl1) {
00378             int previ, nexti;
00379             float min = 1e32;
00380 
00381             /* BMESH_TODO: Would be nice to do a more thorough analysis of all
00382              * the vertices in both loops to find a more accurate match for the
00383              * starting point and winding direction of the bridge generation. */
00384             
00385             for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(vv1); i++) {
00386                 if (len_v3v3(vv1[i]->co, vv2[0]->co) < min) {
00387                     min = len_v3v3(vv1[i]->co, vv2[0]->co);
00388                     starti = i;
00389                 }
00390             }
00391 
00392             /* Reverse iteration order for the first loop if the distance of
00393              * the (starti - 1) vert from vv1 is a better match for vv2[1] than
00394              * the (starti + 1) vert.
00395              *
00396              * This is not always going to be right, but it will work better in
00397              * the average case.
00398              */
00399             previ = clamp_index(starti - 1, lenv1);
00400             nexti = clamp_index(starti + 1, lenv1);
00401 
00402             /* avoid sqrt for comparison */
00403             if (len_squared_v3v3(vv1[nexti]->co, vv2[1]->co) > len_squared_v3v3(vv1[previ]->co, vv2[1]->co)) {
00404                 /* reverse direction for reading vv1 (1 is forward, -1 is backward) */
00405                 dir1 = -1;
00406             }
00407         }
00408 
00409         /* Vert rough attempt to determine proper winding for the bridge quads:
00410          * just uses the first loop it finds for any of the edges of ee2 or ee1 */
00411         if (wdir == 0) {
00412             for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(ee2); i++) {
00413                 if (ee2[i]->l) {
00414                     wdir = (ee2[i]->l->v == vv2[i]) ? (-1) : (1);
00415                     break;
00416                 }
00417             }
00418         }
00419         if (wdir == 0) {
00420             for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(ee1); i++) {
00421                 j = clamp_index((i * dir1) + starti, BLI_array_count(ee1));
00422                 if (ee1[j]->l && ee2[j]->l) {
00423                     wdir = (ee2[j]->l->v == vv2[j]) ? (1) : (-1);
00424                     break;
00425                 }
00426             }
00427         }
00428         
00429         /* Generate the bridge quads */
00430         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(ee1) && i < BLI_array_count(ee2); i++) {
00431             BMFace *f;
00432 
00433             BMLoop *l_1 = NULL;
00434             BMLoop *l_2 = NULL;
00435             BMLoop *l_1_next = NULL;
00436             BMLoop *l_2_next = NULL;
00437             BMLoop *l_iter;
00438             BMFace *f_example;
00439 
00440             int i1, i1next, i2, i2next;
00441 
00442             i1 = clamp_index(i * dir1 + starti, lenv1);
00443             i1next = clamp_index((i + 1) * dir1 + starti, lenv1);
00444             i2 = i;
00445             i2next = clamp_index(i + 1, lenv2);
00446 
00447             if (vv1[i1] ==  vv1[i1next]) {
00448                 continue;
00449             }
00450 
00451             if (wdir < 0) {
00452                 SWAP(int, i1, i1next);
00453                 SWAP(int, i2, i2next);
00454             }
00455 
00456             /* get loop data - before making the face */
00457             bm_vert_loop_pair(bm, vv1[i1], vv2[i2], &l_1, &l_2);
00458             bm_vert_loop_pair(bm, vv1[i1next], vv2[i2next], &l_1_next, &l_2_next);
00459             /* copy if loop data if its is missing on one ring */
00460             if (l_1 && l_1_next == NULL) l_1_next = l_1;
00461             if (l_1_next && l_1 == NULL) l_1 = l_1_next;
00462             if (l_2 && l_2_next == NULL) l_2_next = l_2;
00463             if (l_2_next && l_2 == NULL) l_2 = l_2_next;
00464             f_example = l_1 ? l_1->f : (l_2 ? l_2->f : NULL);
00465 
00466             f = BM_face_create_quad_tri(bm,
00467                                         vv1[i1],
00468                                         vv2[i2],
00469                                         vv2[i2next],
00470                                         vv1[i1next],
00471                                         f_example, TRUE);
00472             if (!f || f->len != 4) {
00473                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: in bridge! (bmesh internal error)\n", __func__);
00474             }
00475             else {
00476                 l_iter = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(f);
00477 
00478                 if (l_1)      BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, l_1,      l_iter); l_iter = l_iter->next;
00479                 if (l_2)      BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, l_2,      l_iter); l_iter = l_iter->next;
00480                 if (l_2_next) BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, l_2_next, l_iter); l_iter = l_iter->next;
00481                 if (l_1_next) BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, l_1_next, l_iter);
00482             }
00483         }
00484     }
00485 
00486 cleanup:
00487     BLI_array_free(ee1);
00488     BLI_array_free(ee2);
00489     BLI_array_free(vv1);
00490     BLI_array_free(vv2);
00491 }
